article.title: Weak representations, representations up to homotopy, and VB-groupoids

multiple_choice_question.text: The article introduces the concept of "weak representations" of a Lie groupoid G. Which of the following best describes the relationship between weak representations and representations up to homotopy?
choices: Weak representations are a generalization of representations up to homotopy, allowing for actions on more general graded manifolds.
Weak representations are a special case of representations up to homotopy, with additional restrictions on the quasi-actions and coherence conditions.
Weak representations and representations up to homotopy are equivalent concepts, offering different but interchangeable perspectives on groupoid actions.
There is no direct relationship between weak representations and representations up to homotopy, as they address different aspects of groupoid theory.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is a VB-groupoid over a Lie groupoid G?
choices: A Lie groupoid equipped with a vector bundle structure over its space of objects.
A map of Lie groupoids π: V → G where π<sub>0</sub>: V<sub>0</sub> → G<sub>0</sub> and π<sub>1</sub>: V<sub>1</sub> → G<sub>1</sub> are vector bundles, and all structure maps are vector bundle maps.
A Lie groupoid where the source and target maps are vector bundle projections.
A Lie groupoid whose space of morphisms is a vector bundle over its space of objects.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Diagram (2), what do the natural isomorphisms δ and α represent in the context of weak actions and equivariant maps?
choices: δ represents the action of G on H, while α relates this action to the action of G on H\'.
δ relates the map F with the actions of G on H and H\', while α represents the natural isomorphism associated with the weak action on H.
δ relates the map F with the actions of G on H and H\', while α represents the natural isomorphism associated with the weak action on H\'.
δ represents the composition of actions of G on H and H\', while α relates this composition to the map F.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main result established by Theorem 5.5?
choices: Every VB-groupoid can be realized as the action groupoid of a weak representation.
There exists a bijection between isomorphism classes of VB-groupoids and weak representations.
The category of VB-groupoids and the category of weak representations are equivalent.
The action groupoid construction defines a functor from the category of weak representations to the category of VB-groupoids.
